title: Bedcover (USA), 1805–15
medium:
Medium: linen warp, cotton weft
Technique: 1/2 twill embroidered with the following stitches – satin, stem, daisey, herringbone, overcast loops, and French knots; cotton fringe of two-strand countered twining (two sets) with long weft loops on one side
description: Square white-on-white embroidered bedcover with rounded corners at bottom. At bottom center a small urn with flowers on stems that branch off and curve up sides with flowers and leaves attached. In center, an eight-pointed star within a fine floral frame. At top a cartouche containing the initials "OS." Narrow outer scrolling border. Length of fringe sewn to sides and bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:

1976-91-1
